title: Stupa
summary: A stupa (Sanskrit: स्तूप, lit. 'heap', IAST: stūpa) is a mound-like or hemispherical structure containing relics (such as śarīra – typically the remains of Buddhist monks or nuns) that is used as a place of meditation.[1] A related architectural term is a chaitya , which is a prayer hall or temple containing a stupa.
